act:act.act:title: Special Wine Store Licence Auction Act

bcl:definition.bcl:text: auction means an auction conducted under this Act;
auction procedures means the procedures referred to in section 5 (1);
general manager's list means the list of successful bidders that the general manager keeps in accordance with section 7;
grocery store means a store that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is primarily engaged in retailing food and non-alcoholic beverages that are specified in the regulations, and
has an area of at least 929 square metres;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: special wine store licence means a licence that authorizes the licensee

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to sell wine in respect of which the naturally occurring sugar used in the fermentation process comes from only

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: plant products grown in British Columbia,
honey produced from beehives located in British Columbia, or
milk from animals located in British Columbia,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to sell cider in respect of which the naturally occurring sugar used in the fermentation process comes only from plant products grown in British Columbia,
to sell sake in respect of which the rice used in its production is grown only in British Columbia, and
to sell the wine, cider and sake from any location approved by the general manager within a specified grocery store;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: successful bidder means a bidder whose bid at an auction is successful as determined under the auction procedures, and includes a bidder who is added to the general manager's list in accordance with section 11.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The definitions in the Liquor Control and Licensing Act apply to this Act.
The general manager may conduct one or more auctions to receive bids for the right to apply for a special wine store licence.
Bids may be accepted under this Act in respect of only a prescribed number of special wine store licences.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Right to apply for special wine store licence
bcl:section.bcl:text: Only a successful bidder on the general manager's list for a specified grocery store may apply under the Liquor Control and Licensing Act for a special wine store licence for that grocery store.
The general manager must not accept a bid from a bidder unless

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the bidder specifies an existing or proposed grocery store from which wine, cider and sake are intended to be sold,
the bidder submits a deposit in the prescribed amount by certified cheque or in another prescribed form,
the bid is equal to or greater than the minimum bid established by the auction procedures, and
the bidder satisfies any other requirement of the auction procedures.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An auction must be conducted in accordance with procedures established by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the regulations, and
the rules made by the general manager under section 16.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The general manager must post, in advance of an auction, the auction procedures on a publicly accessible website maintained by or on behalf of the minister.
The general manager is responsible for the conduct of an auction.

The general manager may enter into agreements authorizing a person or organization that has expertise in conducting auctions to conduct, under the supervision of the general manager, all or a part of an auction.
The general manager must keep a list of all successful bidders, together with the grocery store specified in the bid of each successful bidder.
The number of grocery stores specified on the list must not exceed the prescribed number of special wine store licences for which bids may be accepted.
The general manager must substitute, on the list, a different existing or proposed grocery store in respect of a bid of a successful bidder if the successful bidder

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: submits an application in a form acceptable to the general manager requesting the substitution, and
pays the prescribed fee.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The general manager must keep a record of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: all bidders who met the requirements set out in section 4, but were unsuccessful, and
the grocery store specified in each unsuccessful bid.

bcl:section.bcl:text: No special wine store licence may be issued to a successful bidder on the general manager's list unless the auction price in respect of the bid has been paid within the prescribed time after the bidder has been notified by the general manager that the bidder's application for the special wine store licence has been approved.
The general manager must remove a successful bidder and the grocery store associated with the bid of the successful bidder from the general manager's list in the following circumstances:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the successful bidder has not paid the auction price in respect of the bid of that successful bidder within the prescribed time after being notified by the general manager that the successful bidder's application for a special wine store licence for that grocery store has been approved;
the successful bidder requests the general manager to do so.

bcl:section.bcl:text: If the general manager removes a successful bidder from the general manager's list, the general manager must add to the general manager's list the bidder on the record of unsuccessful bidders having the highest priority, as determined under the auction procedures, together with the grocery store specified in the bid of that bidder.

Subject to any prescribed exceptions, the deposit of a successful bidder submitted in respect of a grocery store is forfeited to the government if the bidder and grocery store are removed from the general manager's list.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The general manager must return a deposit submitted by a bidder in respect of a grocery store if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the bidder is on the record of unsuccessful bidders and has requested the return of the deposit, or
the bidder is on the record of unsuccessful bidders and the prescribed number of special wine store licences have been issued.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a deposit is returned to an unsuccessful bidder under subsection (1) (a), the general manager must remove the bidder and the grocery store from the record of unsuccessful bidders and the unsuccessful bidder may no longer be added to the general manager's list in respect of that bid.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Section 5 of the Offence Act does not apply to this Act or the regulations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations referred to in section 41 of the Interpretation Act.
Without limiting subsection (1), the Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: prescribing the number of special wine store licences in respect of which bids may be accepted under this Act;
specifying the types of food and non-alcoholic beverages for the purposes of the definition of "grocery store";
prescribing the amount of deposits submitted under section 4 (b);
respecting the additional forms of deposits that may be submitted under section 4 (b);
prescribing the fee referred to in section 7 (3) (b);
respecting procedures for the conduct of an auction, including

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: how to calculate the amount that a successful bidder must pay for the right to apply for a special wine store licence,
how to determine the priority of unsuccessful bidders on the record of unsuccessful bidders, and
any contractual rights or obligations of the government or a bidder arising on acceptance of a bid at the auction;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: prescribing the time periods for the purposes of sections 9 and 10 (a) and (b);
providing for exceptions to the forfeiture of deposits under section 12;
remedying any difficulty encountered in the conduct of an auction or in the administration of this Act.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The general manager may make rules respecting procedures for the conduct of an auction, including

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: how to determine successful bids,
how to calculate the amount that a successful bidder must pay for the right to apply for a special wine store licence,
how to determine the priority of unsuccessful bidders on the record of unsuccessful bidders, and
any contractual rights or obligations of the government or a bidder arising on acceptance of a bid at the auction.

bcl:section.bcl:text: If there is any conflict between the rules made by the general manager and the regulations, the regulations prevail.

bcl:editorialnote.in:em: [Note: See Table of Legislative Changes for the status of section 18.]

bcl:section.bcl:text: This Act may be repealed by regulation of the Lieutenant Governor in Council.
This Act comes into force by regulation of the Lieutenant Governor in Council.
